channel.title: Client error
channel.description: when i run my client it say the path cannot be specified but its got the right code in and staff and ive done the thing where you specify the path , my server run and compile works awsome but it says it when i run the compile this is whats in the client [code]@ECHO OFF TITLE ELEMENTAL Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0.10 \bin\java.exe" -cp . *.java pause[/code]

item.title: Client error
item.dc:creator: @jjones10 jjones10
item.description:
@jjones10 wrote:

Hey wait! i see your problem. there is a space between 10 and /bin. take it out and see what happens =]

Read full topic

item.title: Client error
item.dc:creator: @adamp40 adamp40
item.description:
@adamp40 wrote:

try mine- it searches for all the jdk versions

@echo off color 0a title AcId BliTZ c0mp1lEr if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

or if that doesnt work try

My Computer-Properties-Advanced-Environmental Variables-

Then check if classpath is set to

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_XX\bin

The XX being an jdk verison that has been installed on the machine

Read full topic

item.title: Client error
item.dc:creator: @sticky_wicky sticky wicky
item.description:
@sticky_wicky wrote:

[quote=“jjones10, post:2, topic:244323”]Okay listen, go to C:\program files\java and look and soo what version of jdk you have. then replace "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0.10 \bin\java.exe" -cp . *.java pause

with "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0.** \bin\java.exe" -cp . *.java pause

The ** meaning 07 or 06 or 05 or whatever version you have[/quote]
i did but doesnt work

Read full topic

item.title: Client error
item.dc:creator: @jjones10 jjones10
item.description:
@jjones10 wrote:

Okay listen, go to C:\program files\java and look and soo what version of jdk you have. then replace "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0.10 \bin\java.exe" -cp . *.java pause

with "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0.** \bin\java.exe" -cp . *.java pause

The ** meaning 07 or 06 or 05 or whatever version you have

Read full topic
